page.title: 19HEALTH IN OUR COMMUNITY
page.content: {HOSPITALS}The area has three hospitals all of which are scheduled for closure by the year 2000, when facilities will be transferred to Derriford. {ROYAL EYE INFIRMARY}Opened in 1897, it occupies one building and has a small in-patient section. There are 35 beds and the chief operations are cataracts and corneal grafts. Modern techniques, including lasers, are used. {FREEDOM FIELDS}Formerly a workhouse, the hospital was opened in 1857, occupying 26 buildings and has 28 wards providing 434 beds It has a large casualty department and handles 111,000 outpatients a year. {GREENBANK}Adjacent to Freedom Fields and built in 1884 this hospital deals chiefly with surgical cases. It has 14 wards, providing 205 beds and occupies 14 buildings. There are five operating theatres.
